A car travelling with a uniform velocity of 30ms-1 along a horizontal road overcomes a constant frictional force of 600N. Calculate the power of the engine of the car
A rectangular block of dimensions 2.0m x 1.0m x 0.5m weighs 200N. calculate the maximum pressure exerted by the block on a horizontal floor.
explanation:
P = \(\frac{wt}{A} = \frac{200}{0.5 \times 1} = 400Nm^{-2}\)
This is because Area is inversely proportional to pressure, so an increase in pressure leads to a decrease in area and vice versa.

An object of mass 2kg moving with a velocity 3ms-11 collides head-on with another object of mass 1kg moving in the opposite direction with a velocity of 4ms-1. If the objects stick together after collision, calculate their common speed.
A ball is dropped and it hits the floor at a point A. It rebounds upward to a point B. While moving from A to B its?
explanation:
The Kinetic Energy of a body is energy possessed by a body as a result of its motion.
Hence, while in motion the kinetic energy of a body changes into potential energy as it rebounds from the floor

text: Which of the following devices convert heat energy to electrical energy?
An object of mass 0.25kg moves at a height h above the ground with a speed of 4ms-1, if its mechanical energy at this height is 12 J, determine the value of h. [g = 10ms-1]
explanation:
The total mechanical energy E at height h is given by: E = PE + KE
E = mgh + \(\frac{1}{2}\)mv\(^2\)
12 = (0.25 x 10 x h) + (0.5 x 0.25 x 4 x 4)
12 = 2.5h + 2
2.5h = 12 - 2 = 10
h = \(\frac{10}{2.5}\) = 4m.

text: Which of the following equations for the efficiency of a machine is correct?
explanation: EFFICIENCY is the ratio of useful work done by the machine to the total work put into the machine.

text: In the day time, it is possible to see under shady areas such as under a tree because light has undergone
The distance between a concave mirror and an object placed in front of it is 1.0m. If the raduis of curvature of the mirror is 4.0m, the image formed will be
explanation:
The focal length of a concave mirror is negative
f = -2m
\(\frac{1}{f} = \frac{1}{v} + \frac{1}{u}\)
\(\frac{1}{-2} = \frac{1}{v} - \frac{1}{1}\)
\(\frac{1}{v} = \frac{1}{-2} + \frac{1}{1}\)
\(\frac{1}{v} =  \frac{1}{2}\)
v = 2m
The image distance is 2.0 m in front of the mirror

text: The image of an object formed by a convex mirror is
When viewed straight down, a fish in a pond is

options.A: father below than it appears to be
options.B: nearer than it appears to be
options.C: found at exactly the same point it is seen

explanation: When viewed straight down, a fish in a pond appears nearer than it is. This is due to the bending of light as it travels from water to air, which causes the fish to appear closer to the surface than it is. This phenomenon is called refraction. As a result, the fish's actual position in the water is farther below than it appears to be when viewed from above.

A voltmeter is a device that

options.D: is able to measure both voltage and current

explanation:
A voltmeter is a device used to measure the voltage across two points in an electrical circuit. To achieve accurate measurements without interfering with the circuit's operation, a voltmeter is constructed with:
Very High ResistanceThis high resistance limits the current drawn from the circuit, allowing the voltage measurement to be taken without altering the conditions of the circuit.

Nuclear fission is preffered to nuclear fusion in the generation of energy because

options.A: very high temperature are required for fusion
options.B: the raw materials for fusion are easily obtained
options.C: energy obtained from fusion is relatively small
options.D: the by-products of fusion is very dangerous

explanation:
Elevated temperatures are necessary to initiate fusion but not fission reactionsbecause, In a fission reaction, the positively charged nucleus and neutrally charged neutrons clash to start the fission process. The procedure can be carried out at lower temperatures since it has a low activation barrier.
NOTE:fusion creates less radioactive material thanfission.
